--- title: "Jihong Zhang" subtitle: 'Learn harder, Play harder' comments: false toc: false sidebar: false about: id: hero-heading template: solana image: "images/profile-2.JPG" image-shape: rounded image-width: 20em links: - icon: bi-person-lines-fill text: C.V. href: uploads/Curriculum_Vitae.pdf - icon: envelope text: Email href: mailto:jzhang@uark.edu - icon: twitter text: Twitter href: https://twitter.com/jihongzgamma - icon: github text: Github href: https://github.com/JihongZ - icon: bi-bookmark-heart-fill text: ORCID href: https://orcid.org/0000-0003-2820-3734 listing: - id: posts contents: posts/*/*.[Rq]md type: grid fields: [image, date, reading-time, title] sort: "date desc" sort-ui: false filter-ui: false page-size: 3 feed: true - id: lectures contents: posts/Lectures/*/*_syllabus.[Rq]md type: grid fields: - image - title - subtitle sort: "date desc" format: html: code-fold: false code-tools: false --- ```{html}
``` ::: {#hero-heading} I currently hold the position of [Assistant Professor of Educational Statistics and Research Methods](https://esrm.uark.edu/directory/uid/jzhang/name/Jihong+Zhang/) (ESRM) at the department of Counseling, Leadership, and Research Methods (CLRM), University of Arkansas. Previously, I served as a postdoctoral fellow at the Chinese University of Hong Kong in the department of Social Work. My academic journey in psychometrics starts with a doctoral training with [Dr. Jonathan Templin](https://jonathantemplin.com/) in the Educational Measurement and Statistics (EMS) program at the University of Iowa. My primary research recently focuses on reliability and validation of psychological/psychometric network, Bayesian latent variable modeling, Item Response Theory modeling, and other advanced psychometric modeling. My expertise lies in the application of advanced statistical modeling in the fields of psychology and education, including multilevel modeling and structural equation modeling. My work is characterized by a commitment to enhancing the methodological understanding and application of statistics in educational research and beyond. ::: ::: {.panel-tabset align="left"} ## Experience - University of Arkansas \| **Assistant Professor** \| [Dec 2022 - Current]{style="color:darkgrey;"} - The Chinese University of Hong Kong \| **Postdoctoral Fellow** \| [Dec 2022 - June 2023]{style="color:darkgrey;"} - Stanford Research Institute (SRI) \| **Associate Researcher (Intern)** \| [June 2021 - Jan 2022]{style="color:darkgrey;"} ## Interests - Bayesian Psychometric Modeling - Psychometric network and Latent variable modeling - Machine Learning and data mining in Education - Diagnostic Classification Models ## Education - **Ph.D.** \| Educational Measurement & Statistics \| University of Iowa \| [2019 - 2022]{style="color:darkgrey;"} - **M.S.** \| Educational Psychology \| University of Kansas\| [2015 - 2019]{style="color:darkgrey;"} - **B.S.** \| Applied Psychology \| Soochow University \| [2009 - 2013]{#date style="color:darkgrey;"} - **B.S.** \| Law \| Soochow University \| [2011 - 2013]{style="color:darkgrey;"} ::: ## Teaching ::: {#lectures} ::: ## Recent posts ::: {#posts} :::
